dict.string: Coverage (2@)
@CoverSA

Hello ____,


Thank you for your patience regarding this issue. I just received an update from our carrier and they have informed us that international numeric SenderIDs are not allowed to Saudi Arabia. This is a limitation imposed by networks in Saudi Arabia. The current workaround is to use Alpha SenderIDs to reach Saudi Arabia numbers. To use Alpha SenderIDs please make sure your Twilio account is upgraded. If you are interested in using Alpha SenderIDs to reach Saudi Arabia numbers, please see below as it does require pre-registration with our carrier and additional requirements.


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181348-Getting-started-with-Alphanumeric-Sender-ID



To learn more about best practices when sending messages to Saudi Arabia, please review our SMS Guidelines Towards Saudi Arabia below:


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/sa 



If interested, please provide the following information (ADD SA PRE-REG TEMPLATE HERE)


I look forward to hearing back from you.



Thanks,

Josephine


----


OPTION 2: - PRE-REGISTERED SENDERID REQUIRED



Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support and your interest in sending messages towards Saudi Arabia. 


Please note that all SMS termination in Saudi Arabia (Transactional or Promotional) needs to have all the sender ID´s pre registered. For more information, please review the best practices to send messages to Saudi Arabia in our SMS Guidelines for Saudi Arabia below:


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/sa 


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Coverage - Saudia Arabia Numeric SenderIDs Not Allowed

Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.

DF5D433E-0DE6-47AD-95D8-C2DA792EF9E5
@CoverNigeriaBlock

Hello ______, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are experiencing _____ when sending messages to Nigeria. 


Please note that Numeric Sender IDs and generic alpha Sender IDs are being blocked by some networks in Nigeria and delivery will be attempted on a best efforts basis. You may experience delayed or undelivered messages. MTN and Glo Mobile are especially strict at blocking messages. We highly recommend sending with a pre-registered alpha Sender ID, specific to your brand and related to the message content to avoid any blocking. If you are interested in pre-registering for an Alpha SenderID for Nigeria, please let me know as I will need to gather additional information from you to start the pre-registration process. 


For more information on best practices when sending messages towards Nigeria, please review our Nigeria Guidelines below:


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/ng


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,


Josephine T.

Technical Support Engineer

Twilio, Inc
Coverage - Nigeria Blocking of Numeric and Generic Alpha SenderIDs

Hello ______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are experiencing _____ when sending messages to Nigeria.
Please note that Numeric Sender IDs and generic alpha Sender IDs are being blocked by some networks in Nigeria and delivery will be attempted on a best efforts basis. You may experience delayed or undelivered messages. MTN and Glo Mobile are especially strict at blocking messages. We highly recommend sending with a pre-registered alpha Sender ID, specific to your brand and related to the message content to avoid any blocking. If you are interested in pre-registering for an Alpha SenderID for Nigeria, please let me know as I will need to gather additional information from you to start the pre-registration process.
For more information on best practices when sending messages towards Nigeria, please review our Nigeria Guidelines below:
https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/ng
I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
Josephine T. Technical Support Engineer Twilio, Inc
@CoverItaly

Hello _____,


Thank you for your patience regarding this issue. I just received an update from our carrier and they have informed us that international numeric SenderIDs are not allowed to Italy. This is a limitation imposed by networks in Italy. The current workaround is to use Alpha SenderIDs to reach Italian numbers. If you are interested in using Alpha SenderIDs to reach Italian numbers, please see the Get Started documentation below. Italy does not require pre-registration. Please feel free to replace the "From" parameter with the Alpha SenderID you will like to use when sending messages to Italian numbers.


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181348-Getting-started-with-Alphanumeric-Sender-ID 



Alternatively, you can also use a local Italian number to send messages. It is only international numeric SenderIDs that are not allowed, for more information regarding our Number Capabilities, please review the below documentation as Italy does require Identity Documentation and Address Verification:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223183068-Twilio-international-phone-number-availability-and-their-capabilities 


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115009614307-Identity-Verification


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,

Josephine
Coverage - Italy Numeric SenderID Not Allowed

B64BB58A-CE1C-484F-A9DF-658DBBE54F24
@CoverTanzania

Hello _____,


Thank you for your patience regarding this issue. I just received an update from our carrier and they have informed us that international numeric SenderIDs are not allowed to Tanzania. This is a limitation imposed by networks in Tanzania. The current workaround is to use Alpha SenderIDs to reach Tanzania numbers. If you are interested in using Alpha SenderIDs to reach Tanzania numbers, please see below as it does require pre-registration with our carrier and additional requirements. 


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181348-Getting-started-with-Alphanumeric-Sender-ID 


To move forward with pre-registration for Tanzania, please provide the following information:




  • Your email address and Twilio Account SID
  • Company Legal Name
  • Company Website (or app/service website if applicable)
  • Sender ID that you wish to register. This ID should be purely alphanumeric, no special characters and a maximum of 11 characters
  • Estimated monthly volume of messages to Tanzania
  • A message sample as well as description of the use case, in particular what the content and purpose of these messages are.
  • Confirmation that this use case will apply to all messages sent to Tanzania from this account.
  • Acknowledgement that if you need to send non-transactional messages, you will need to use a different account or subaccount.




Please note, Twilio only approves transactional messaging for alpha sender ID pre-registration in Tanzania. These are typically messages that include account alerts, two-factor authentication codes or OTP (one-time password) to subscribers.


Once I have received all this information, we will review and submit your application for consideration with the local authorities. Feel free to reach out with any questions!


Best,

Josephine
Coverage - Tanzania Numeric SenderIDs Not Allowed

To move forward with pre-registration for Tanzania, please provide the following information:
• Your email address and Twilio Account SID • Company Legal Name • Company Website (or app/service website if applicable) • Sender ID that you wish to register. This ID should be purely alphanumeric, no special characters and a maximum of 11 characters • Estimated monthly volume of messages to Tanzania • A message sample as well as description of the use case, in particular what the content and purpose of these messages are. • Confirmation that this use case will apply to all messages sent to Tanzania from this account. • Acknowledgement that if you need to send non-transactional messages, you will need to use a different account or subaccount.
Please note, Twilio only approves transactional messaging for alpha sender ID pre-registration in Tanzania. These are typically messages that include account alerts, two-factor authentication codes or OTP (one-time password) to subscribers.
Once I have received all this information, we will review and submit your application for consideration with the local authorities. Feel free to reach out with any questions!
Best, Josephine
97B66BBC-94EE-46EB-AC7A-AEF5F78981DB
@CoverCACNigeria

Hello ___, 


Thank you for checking in and for providing additional information. Unfortunately, both the Local License CAC Form and SenderID NOC Registration Form are require by Nigerian carriers to proceed with Nigeria Alpha SenderID Pre-registration. Without these materials, we will not be able to proceed. You can consider using numeric Sender IDs and generic alpha Sender IDs (using regular Alpha SenderID without pre-registration). However, please be aware that your messages may be blocked by some networks in Nigeria and will be attempted on a best efforts basis.


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. 


Thanks,
Coverage - Nigeria Pre-regstration Without CAC Form

Without these materials, we will not be able to proceed. You can consider using numeric Sender IDs and generic alpha Sender IDs (using regular Alpha SenderID without pre-registration). However, please be aware that your messages may be blocked by some networks in Nigeria and will be attempted on a best efforts basis.
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.
Thanks,

@CoverBN

Hello _____,


Thank you very much for your patience, I really appreciate it. I just received an update from our carrier and our carrier has informed us that due Netherlands carrier regulations when send messages using a platform (Application/Twilio to Person traffic) the SenderID will be replaced with a short code (i.e. 8850). Unfortunately, this is out of Twilio's control as it is modified when reaching Netherlands carriers. You will not see the same behavior when using a Netherlands mobile phone to send messages to other Netherlands mobile phones.


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Coverage - Netherlands AND Belgium Modified to Short Code to 8850

Unfortunately, this is out of Twilio's control as it is modified when reaching Netherlands carriers. You will not see the same behavior when using a Netherlands mobile phone to send messages to other Netherlands mobile phones.
I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
@CoverChinaGeneric

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. 


May you please confirm are you referring to the generic signature appended to your China whitelisted template? 


Please note that if you will like to change the signature there is a process and fee for it. Below are the details. Please let me know if you will like to proceed in changing the signature. Please provide the below information:


  • Signature length - Can be over 4 characters
  • Can be at the beginning or end of the message
  • Chinese Business license certificate of the Signature owner
  • Lead time is 2 to 3 weeks depending on Signature availability and other dependencies on our carrier
  • There is a One-time setup fee cost to Twilio of $75 


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Coverage - China Change Generic Signature

Dear ____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.
May you please confirm are you referring to the generic signature appended to your China whitelisted template?
Please note that if you will like to change the signature there is a process and fee for it. Below are the details. Please let me know if you will like to proceed in changing the signature. Please provide the below information:
• Signature length - Can be over 4 characters • Can be at the beginning or end of the message • Chinese Business license certificate of the Signature owner • Lead time is 2 to 3 weeks depending on Signature availability and other dependencies on our carrier • There is a One-time setup fee cost to Twilio of $75
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
@CoverMexico

Hello _____,


Thank you for providing information regarding your use case, I appreciate it.

Below are some limitations on Mexican long code numbers you should be aware of:

Mexican mobile numbers are in Developer Preview/ Alpha stage. Please note that since this number is not in General Availability, you should be aware that occasionally these numbers reveals issues that we cannot detect in our test labs. Please keep this in mind as you deploy these numbers as part of your application. It is not advisable to use these for critical path or production systems until we have more experience with the numbers and are able to put them into Beta.


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/230434707-Developer-preview-phone-number-availability


There is a 10 messages per second threshold for all international long code numbers (not just Mexican long code numbers).


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues


Twilio can receive up to 100 concurrent API request at a time to send outbound messages.

https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues


There is no limitation of how many message are sent inbound to your Twilio number. Twilio has unlimited concurrent inbound messages. Please note that since Twilio makes an HTTP request to your server for each inbound message we receive, make sure to perform load testing on your server if you are expecting a high volume of traffic. I will advise to ensure that your server can handle the increase traffic and load as you have more users sending inbound messages.


Mexican mobile numbers should only be used for 2-way, peer-to-peer communication.

No marketing traffic is allowed. Please make sure that your surveys are not marketing related as Mexican carriers will aggressively filter and block marketing traffic.


For full details of the Mexico SMS Guidelines, please see below:


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/mx


Please take a look at the information above and let me know if you have further questions on the call tomorrow. Look forward to talking to you tomorrow.


Thanks,
Coverage - The Risk of Mexico Alpha Mobile Numbers

Thank you for providing information regarding your use case, I appreciate it.

Please note that since this number is not in General Availability, you should be aware that occasionally these numbers reveals issues that we cannot detect in our test labs. https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues
Twilio can receive up to 100 concurrent API request at a time to send outbound messages. https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues
There is no limitation of how many message are sent inbound to your Twilio number. Twilio has unlimited concurrent inbound messages. Please note that since Twilio makes an HTTP request to your server for each inbound message we receive, make sure to perform load testing on your server if you are expecting a high volume of traffic. I will advise to ensure that your server can handle the increase traffic and load as you have more users sending inbound messages.
Mexican mobile numbers should only be used for 2-way, peer-to-peer communication. No marketing traffic is allowed. Please make sure that your surveys are not marketing related as Mexican carriers will aggressively filter and block marketing traffic.
For full details of the Mexico SMS Guidelines, please see below:
https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/mx
Please take a look at the information above and let me know if you have further questions on the call tomorrow. Look forward to talking to you tomorrow.
Thanks,
CBA986CA-E0D5-4832-A5C7-DFE72FDCE8EF
@CoverSerbia

Also, our carrier has also informed us, please be aware that Serbia has very strong filtering mechanisms on numbers and sender IDs may not be preserved, therefore you can expect SenderIDs to be changed into "SMS_Info" in order to ensure successful delivery.
Coverage - Serbia SenderIDs not Preserved

Also, our carrier has also informed us, please be aware that Serbia has very strong filtering mechanisms on numbers and sender IDs may not be preserved, therefore you can expect SenderIDs to be changed into "SMS_Info" in order to ensure successful delivery.
@CoverBrazil

Hello ____,


Thank you very much for your patience. I just received an update from our carrier and they have confirmed that this is a limitation on Brazilian networks where they are unable preserve SenderID even if you are using Twilio Brazilian "from" numbers to send messages to other Brazilian numbers. International numbers such as using US numbers may also experience this same limitation. The Twilio Brazilian "from" numbers will be modified to a short code (i.e. 28908) or a different Brazilian local number by networks in Brazil. Unfortunately, this is a limitation imposed by Brazilian networks and is out of Twilio's control.


Twilio Brazilian numbers only support 1-way messaging. If you will like your end users to be able to reply to your messages, I will highly recommend including the "reply number" in your messages so that end users will be able to respond.


For more information about guidelines and limitations in sending messages to Brazil, please refer below:


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/br


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Coverage - Brazil Cannot Preserve Brazilian Numeric SenderIDs

Hello ____,
Thank you very much for your patience. I just received an update from our carrier and they have confirmed that this is a limitation on Brazilian networks where they are unable preserve SenderID even if you are using Twilio Brazilian "from" numbers to send messages to other Brazilian numbers. International numbers such as using US numbers may also experience this same limitation. The Twilio Brazilian "from" numbers will be modified to a short code (i.e. 28908) or a different Brazilian local number by networks in Brazil. Unfortunately, this is a limitation imposed by Brazilian networks and is out of Twilio's control.
Twilio Brazilian numbers only support 1-way messaging. If you will like your end users to be able to reply to your messages, I will highly recommend including the "reply number" in your messages so that end users will be able to respond.
For more information about guidelines and limitations in sending messages to Brazil, please refer below:
https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/br
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
@CoverUAE

(1) SPAM FILTERING BY ETISALAT:



Hello ______,

After thorough investigation it appears that there is strict spam filtering of messages in the UAE, particularly by Etisalat, hence inconsistent delivery of messages. Unfortunately, this is outside of Twilio's control as the destination carriers UAE do not share their criteria for message filtering to Twilio. There is also additional spam filtering in place from 'du', the other major carrier in the UAE. It appears that the affected number you have reported is from 'du" as well.


However, there is a potential workaround that we can try where we can use a different "from" number instead of using your current Twilio number +12562033322 as the "from" number. This is a temporary solution, however, please note that this is not always guaranteed to work due to strict spam filtering put in place in UAE.


If you will like to give this a try by changing the "from" number, please let me know and I can actively work with our carriers to proceed in using a different "from" number to deliver messages to UAE.


I look forward to hearing back from you.


Thanks,


-------



(2) MUST USE PRE-REGISTERED SENDERID - REGULAR NUMBERIC SENDERID NOT ALLOWED
Coverage - UAE Spam Filtering and Numeric SenderID Not Allowed

(1) SPAM FILTERING BY ETISALAT:
Hello ______,
After thorough investigation it appears that there is strict spam filtering of messages in the UAE, particularly by Etisalat, hence inconsistent delivery of messages. Unfortunately, this is outside of Twilio's control as the destination carriers UAE do not share their criteria for message filtering to Twilio. There is also additional spam filtering in place from 'du', the other major carrier in the UAE. It appears that the affected number you have reported is from 'du" as well.
However, there is a potential workaround that we can try where we can use a different "from" number instead of using your current Twilio number +12562033322 as the "from" number. This is a temporary solution, however, please note that this is not always guaranteed to work due to strict spam filtering put in place in UAE.
If you will like to give this a try by changing the "from" number, please let me know and I can actively work with our carriers to proceed in using a different "from" number to deliver messages to UAE.
I look forward to hearing back from you.
Thanks,
-------
(2) MUST USE PRE-REGISTERED SENDERID - REGULAR NUMBERIC SENDERID NOT ALLOWED
@CoverVietnam

Hello ____,


Thank you very much for your patience, I really appreciate it. I just received a response from our carrier and below is their response to the investigation:


"The reported samples were delivered to the number. However, the route to Vietnam is only for OTP traffic.


We can see the contents are not OTP, so they were switched to random numeric sender.


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/vn


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Coverage - Vietnam Routes only Support OTP Traffic/Transactional Traffic

2B9625EE-9662-45D3-BE5F-FBBCEB456AEF
@CoverBelgium

Hello _____,


Thank you for your patience, I really appreciate it. I just heard back from our carrier and below is their response:


---


"BEL Proximus wanted to ensure no A2P traffic is coming via original SenderID. Proximus requested to change all numeric SenderIDs to 320335320000."


---


Unfortunately, it appears that the destination carrier for ______ is from Bel Proximus and Proximus is enforcing using 320335320000 when messages are going through A2P traffic (Twilio as an application to destination carrier Proximus). As Proximus is enforcing this SenderID, Twilio and our carrier cannot preserve the original Beligium SenderID you are using. I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,


Josephine
Coverage - Belgium Proximus Cannot Preserve SenderID ( Modified to 320335320000)

@CoverPeru

Dear _____,



Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


Thank you for your patience regarding this issue, I really appreciate it. Our Carrier Operations Team just responded back with an update. Our team has been in close contact with Peruvian carriers and they have indicated that using Alphanumeric SenderID to send messages to Peru is not always reliable as Peruvian carriers are always blocking and filtering messages. Our best recommendation is to use a +1 number (from US or Canada) to send messages to Peru, this can help decrease SenderID being modified. However, since Twilio does not have Peruvian local numbers, using a +1 international number is not always guaranteed to preserve original SenderID.


https://www.twilio.com/console/phone-numbers/search/buy/results?Country=PE&searchType=number&searchTerm=&align=left&capability%5B%5D=any&type%5B%5D=any&requirement%5B%5D=any&beta%5B%5D=true


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,

@CoverRoaming

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that your roaming recipients are not receiving messages.


Unfortunately, Twilio cannot guarantee the deliverability of SMS messaging to roaming phone numbers. Since the numbers are not physically at the location that it normally operates, Twilio cannot guarantee message deliverability. For more information, please see our FAQ below:


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/can-i-send-sms-messages-to-roaming-phone-numbers


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Coverage - Undelivered Messages in Roaming

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that your roaming recipients are not receiving messages.
Unfortunately, Twilio cannot guarantee the deliverability of SMS messaging to roaming phone numbers. Since the numbers are not physically at the location that it normally operates, Twilio cannot guarantee message deliverability. For more information, please see our FAQ below:
https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/can-i-send-sms-messages-to-roaming-phone-numbers
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
53E11FF1-9CC4-4D5B-9C02-3C2DDB4A0BC6
@CoverChinaWhitelist

CHINA GENERAL LIMITATIONS:


To provide some background information, Chinese networks are known to have very strict regulations about the SMS traffic traversed on their network. For example, strictly no promotional SMS is allowed to be sent over into China - transactional SMS only. The networks impose heavy fines and cut off connections if these rules are breached. Also, SMS sent to Chinese numbers can be subject to random 'Manual Reviews' from the aggregator or the mobile carriers. This literally means that SMS are checked and approved by a human being and thus can lead to message delays or blocks.


The good news is that there's the option of registering SMS templates with Chinese networks. If the content is acceptable to them, the templates will be approved and whitelisted so that whenever we send SMS with that particular template they allow the message through automatically. Therefore, we recommend that you go through the template registration process if you know your message content beforehand. The process can take up to a week.


If you would like to proceed, please send us the following information:


Please provide a template of your intended message content.


The template should include a way to identify the company sending the message. While some content such as "First Name", "Last Name", "PIN Code" etc can differ, the general template should be the same with each submission Example: Hello [First Name] [Last Name], your Twilio PIN code is: [123456].


Also, please note: Templates will have a default generic 'Signature' appended to the message, normally [CEG]


Please let me know if you will like us to proceed with the process of China whitelisting and I will continue to keep you posted once I hear back from our carrier.


Thanks,



——



CHINA WHITELISTING LIMITATIONS:


Hello _____,


Thank you for the information, I appreciate it. I have submitted your template to our carrier for review. Please note that the whitelisting process can take anywhere between 3-5 days. As China has strict regulations, below are a few limitations even for whitelisted templates. Please go over these limitations to avoid your messages from not being delivered:


  • Only ten (10) messages can be sent to any one destination within any one 24 hour period

  • Three (3) identical messages submitted to the same number within 24 hours would be rejected

  • Five (5) different messages submitted to the same number within 24 hours would be delayed due to manual checking even if the message template is whitelisted

Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Coverage - China General and Whitelisting Limitations

CHINA GENERAL LIMITATIONS:
To provide some background information, Chinese networks are known to have very strict regulations about the SMS traffic traversed on their network. For example, strictly no promotional SMS is allowed to be sent over into China - transactional SMS only. The networks impose heavy fines and cut off connections if these rules are breached. Also, SMS sent to Chinese numbers can be subject to random 'Manual Reviews' from the aggregator or the mobile carriers. This literally means that SMS are checked and approved by a human being and thus can lead to message delays or blocks.
The good news is that there's the option of registering SMS templates with Chinese networks. If the content is acceptable to them, the templates will be approved and whitelisted so that whenever we send SMS with that particular template they allow the message through automatically. Therefore, we recommend that you go through the template registration process if you know your message content beforehand. The process can take up to a week.
If you would like to proceed, please send us the following information:
Please provide a template of your intended message content.
The template should include a way to identify the company sending the message. While some content such as "First Name", "Last Name", "PIN Code" etc can differ, the general template should be the same with each submission Example: Hello [First Name] [Last Name], your Twilio PIN code is: [123456].
Also, please note: Templates will have a default generic 'Signature' appended to the message, normally [CEG]
Please let me know if you will like us to proceed with the process of China whitelisting and I will continue to keep you posted once I hear back from our carrier.
Thanks,
——
CHINA WHITELISTING LIMITATIONS:
Hello _____,
Thank you for the information, I appreciate it. I have submitted your template to our carrier for review. Please note that the whitelisting process can take anywhere between 3-5 days. As China has strict regulations, below are a few limitations even for whitelisted templates. Please go over these limitations to avoid your messages from not being delivered:
• Only ten (10) messages can be sent to any one destination within any one 24 hour period • • Three (3) identical messages submitted to the same number within 24 hours would be rejected • • Five (5) different messages submitted to the same number within 24 hours would be delayed due to manual checking even if the message template is whitelisted • Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
@CoverRussia

Hello _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that your Russian is not preserved.


It appears that there are carrier and network restrictions in Russia and we are unable to currently preserve Alphanumeric SenderID in Russia. Because of the ever-changing SenderID requirements in Russia, our uttermost priority right now is to ensure deliverability of these messages. Our Carrier Operation Team continues to actively work on ways that we can preserve Alphanumeric SenderID in Russia.


I will recommend to check Twilii’s SMS Guidelines in Russia to see if your use case will be suitable for SenderID Pre-registration as SenderID Pre-registration is only supported for high volume traffic that needs to be pre-approved by Russian operators:


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/ru


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Coverage - Russia Cannot Preserve Alphanumeric SenderID

Dear ____,


Thank you for your e-mail. I am sorry to hear that the mobile number doesn't have voice available. Mobile numbers are for sending and receiving SMS messages in UK. Please note that currently all mobile numbers Twilio provides are only SMS-enabled. You can not make or receive voice calls using these numbers.


I apologize for the inconvenience, if you would like voice and SMS capability, I will advise to release this current number and purchase a UK local number. Please note that UK local numbers is voice capable and can send SMS messages within UK only. However, UK mobile numbers can send SMS messages within UK and internationally, but does not have voice capability.


For more information please check these useful FAQs below about the type of phone numbers we offer and it's capabilities:


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/phone-numbers/what-types-of-numbers-does-twilio-offer-and-how-do-they-work


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/phone-numbers/which-countries-does-twilio-have-phone-numbers-in-and-what- are-their-capabilities


I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,


Josephine T.

Customer Support

Twilio, Inc

@CoverNigeria

GLO MOBILE AND MTN LIMITATIONS:


Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that you are unable to deliver SMS messages to Nigerian numbers.


May I ask are you unable to deliver messages to specific Nigerian carrier networks or to all Nigerian carrier networks? The reason I ask is because there are specifically 2 Nigerian carrier networks that are known to experience issues receiving SMS messages:


1) MTN Network -


Please note that many numbers from the MTN network are registered with the DND Registry (Do Not Disturb Registry). From 1st July 2016, MTN Nigeria has installed DND (Do-Not-Disturb) service to all subscribers. Subscribers who activated this feature will not get SMS via the bulk bind to the operator. I will recommend to check in with end users to ensure they are not registered with the DND as this will not allow them to receive messages.


2) Glo Mobile Network -


Glo Mobile is restricting messages sent from SenderIDs that are not Nigerian numbers. For example, using Twilio US numbers to send messages to Glo Mobile numbers. Unfortunately, Twilio does not currently support Nigerian numbers and will not be able to support delivering messages to Glo Mobile. I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.


If the messages you are attempting to send messages to are not MTN numbers and Glo Mobile numbers, please provide 3 SMS SID examples - https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/what-is-an-sms-message-sid from the past 24 hours where you experienced undelivered messages. I will like to further investigate.


I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Coverage - MTN / Glo Mobile Nigeria DND List

GLO MOBILE AND MTN LIMITATIONS:

May I ask are you unable to deliver messages to specific Nigerian carrier networks or to all Nigerian carrier networks? The reason I ask is because there are specifically 2 Nigerian carrier networks that are known to experience issues receiving SMS messages:
1) MTN Network -
Please note that many numbers from the MTN network are registered with the DND Registry (Do Not Disturb Registry). From 1st July 2016, MTN Nigeria has installed DND (Do-Not-Disturb) service to all subscribers. Subscribers who activated this feature will not get SMS via the bulk bind to the operator. I will recommend to check in with end users to ensure they are not registered with the DND as this will not allow them to receive messages.
2) Glo Mobile Network -
Glo Mobile is restricting messages sent from SenderIDs that are not Nigerian numbers. For example, using Twilio US numbers to send messages to Glo Mobile numbers. Unfortunately, Twilio does not currently support Nigerian numbers and will not be able to support delivering messages to Glo Mobile. I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.
If the messages you are attempting to send messages to are not MTN numbers and Glo Mobile numbers, please provide 3 SMS SID examples - https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/what-is-an-sms-message-sid from the past 24 hours where you experienced undelivered messages. I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.

@CoverIndia

ON DO NOT CALL REGISTRY:


Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that messages are not being delivered to India.


I looked through your SMS log and I see that many messages are undelivered, upon further investigation, it appears that many numbers are registered on the National Do Not Call Registry. For example, I took a look at a few recent SMS messages you attempted to send and these numbers are registered on the National Do Not Call Registry, hence the non-delivery. You can further verify you numbers by going to this page below:


http://www.nccptrai.gov.in/nccpregistry/search.misc



If the owner of the phone number wishes to start receiving SMS messages from Twilio, they can update the DNC settings by following the instructions:


http://www.nccptrai.gov.in/nccpregistry/


Due to strict limitations of the India Government in regards to how SMS messages are regulated there are other limitations involved when sending messages to India, please review them below:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134167-Limitations-sending-SMS-messages-to-Indian-mobile-devices


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

------


GENERAL INDIA LIMITATION TEMPLATE:


Dear _____,


Thank you for your e-mail. I am sorry to hear that you are experiencing SMS ______. In our experience, there are several issues due to protective regulations of the Indian government.


This issue is addressed in our help center:


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/are-there-limitations-on-sending-sms-messages-to-indian-mobile-devices


Most likely the messages you have sent were on the Do Not Call registry, or were simply delayed if sent during overnight.

Please note that SMS messages can potentially be delayed or blocked if sent before 9AM or during the night after 9PM Indian time.

Sometimes large numbers of SMS are blocked if they appear to be Spam.


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,


————

RECOMMEND CUSTOMER TO USE PRE-REG SENDER ID:


Lastly, please note, to bypass the Do Not Call/SMS Registry and the other issues mentioned in the above documentation, I will recommend to configure a Pre-Registered Alpha Sender ID. Please note that Pre-Registered Alpha SenderID are meant for transactional traffic only (OTPs, two-factor authentication codes). As I see that your traffic is transactional, we recommend setting up a dedicated subaccount with Pre-Registered Alpha Sender ID configured. This will help ensure delivery for your transactional messages.


For more info see: Getting started with Alphanumeric Sender ID and International support for Alphanumeric Sender ID.


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223133767-International-support-for-Alphanumeric-Sender-ID


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181348-Getting-started-with-Alphanumeric-Sender-ID


Let me know if you are interested in pre-registering an Alpha Sender ID for transactional messaging. In order to begin the pre-registration process, I'll need to send you a form to complete (the process involves vetting your use case to ensure we comply with all local rules and regulations).


I look forward to hearing back from you.


Thanks,


Josephine
Coverage - India Non-Delivery and SMS Limitations
